intro: Standleya prostrata, commonly known as the prostrate standleya, is a flowering plant native to Mexico and parts of Central America. It belongs to the Campanulaceae family and is characterized by its low-growing, sprawling habit. The plant produces small, bell-shaped flowers that are typically white or pale blue in color. Its leaves are opposite, ovate, and covered in fine hairs. Standleya prostrata thrives in moist, shaded environments and is often found in forest understories.
